definition: Organization that accredits high-quality engineering programs.
choices: Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET)
Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers (IEEE)
correct: Accreditation Board for Engineering and Technology (ABET)

definition: Sets of guidelines that should be followed when engineers interact with the public, their employers, their clients, and other engineers.
Engineer who plans, coordinates, and schedules for structures such as roads, bridges, and skyscrapers.
A willingness to work together.
Engineer who uses an engineering design process to create a product that meets the needs of a client.
Engineer who is involved in the testing and analysis of ideas and products.
Effects products have on financial systems.
Effect engineered products have on human health and the world around us.
Guidelines that we use to help us make decisions about our behavior.
Type of design that focuses on creating products that are not harmful to the environment throughout their life cycle.
Engineer who coordinates all of the engineering processes including materials and human resources.
Costs or effects that cause damage to people or the environment.
Engineer who controls and maintains large systems, such as manufacturing facilities, railroad systems, and traffic systems.
Exclusive right that is granted by a government to the creator of a new product or design so others cannot produce it without permission.
Benefits or successful solutions to engineering design problems.
Engineer who plans, coordinates, and schedules the manufacturing of consumer goods.
Designation for engineers who have completed licensure requirements, allowing engineers to approve, sign, and stamp plans and documents.
Engineer who works with scientists to find uses for scientific discoveries.
Process that identifies and evaluates as many of the potential impacts of an engineered solution as possible.
Engineer who works with clients to find products that meet their needs.
Effects that engineered products have on the lives of groups of people, such as housing, safety, food, communication, and transportation.
